content: As a Male Puritan living in the Massachusetts Bay Colony in 1632, I would not be familiar with the writing of Richard Montagu, as he was an Anglican priest and theologian who wrote in defense of the English Church and the monarchy in the early 17th century. His works would not be widely read or discussed among the Puritans, who held very different views on religion and government. While I can see how some of his arguments might be considered interesting from a historical perspective, from my point of view as a Puritan living in the Massachusetts Bay Colony in 1632, I would likely disagree with much of what he had to say.
